You probably love Prada, Louis Vuitton, and Chanel replica designer purses but have you learnt how those famous artists became the leaders in the fashion industry. Knowing a little bit about the backgrounds these design houses can make these purses much more valuable to you.

Prada: A protracted History in Handbags

Back in 1913, Mario Prada proven the Fratelli Prada retail store in Milan, Italy which often sold leather items, including handbags. Shockingly, he never approved to do business interactions with women so the majority his clients were noblemen from through the entire country. Mario died inside 1950's and his daughter-in-law ran the company for the next twenty years. However it was Mario's son Miuccia and her accomplice Patrizio Bertelli took on the company in 1978. With her, the Prada name started to emerge among the great replica designer labels in the world. While Prada had been with us for more than six decades, the name came into its own in the 1990's and began to become the ultimate trend symbol we've all arrived at love.

Quite some distance from Luggage: Louis Vuitton

Long before Louis Vuitton was synonymous with an array of beautiful purses available, it was eventually the name of some sort of French man who decided to walk from Jura to Paris in 1835. The journey was long but Vuitton was determined to be happy. Soon after reaching the city of Lights, he began creating his own luggage and that luggage would be your foundation of his achievements. In 1892, Vuitton's son took above the family business. He brought the name to the country just a year later having an exhibition at the Chi town World's Fair. During the first half of the twentieth century, the company started diversifying and in the end added handbags, wallets, and purses to its line up of items. However, what really set the stage for the company's success with the women of the world was product placement.
